author: m.kalinin
content:
Agree with <@!301186049323958275> that `eth_coinbase` might make sense as the option to pass coinbase as a parameter is not going to be removed and will be probably be useful in some setups. I have walked through the list of JSON-RPC methods and came up with the same subset that is going to be deprecated be the merge.

I think we should keep the part of the API that provides access to uncles untouched. Echoing <@!301186049323958275> here

author: dock_boss
content:
<@!425572898787426305> <@!301186049323958275> 
Okay keeping `eth_coinbase` makes sense to me.
I know that things can change on a dime, but right now it looks like there are plans to implement some form of state expiry sometime this year. Right?
So would it be smart to at least note that the uncle endpoints will eventually be deprecated when Ethereum's state no longer contains any uncle blocks?
Or should I just leave it out for now?

author: dock_boss
content:
Also would `eth_coinbase` return the node operator's "main account" in a post-merge Ethereum?
Instead of the account they would like their block reward sent to?

author: sky.cactus
content: "this year" for state expiry I think may be overly optimistic.

author: dock_boss
content: Sounds good, I am still figuring out the development timeline here. Also I probably do not grasp the full complexity of this problem.
